column4: Hi everyone, can you guys tell me how I can get sun-java6 as default instead of OpenJDK?
the way i do this is simply remove any other jvms
you can type "which java" and "java -version" to verify

When I type "which java" it outputs '/usr/bin/java'...  -   and when I do "java --version" it outputs the three different with 1)'java version "1.6.0_20"' - 2)'Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_20-b02)' - 3)'Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 16.3-b01, mixed mode)'
It doesn't seem that i've done it right does it?
incandenza: Great, I'm glad, now I'll go on and configure Eclipse (:
java -version tells you what actual java is. since file returned by "which java" is a symlink, you can see where to it points by recursively executing "file `which java`"
I must admit I didn't fully understand the "file 'which java'" part :S
if you wish, you can read "man file"
Ah, ok (: well some tutorials on the internet says that i have to put a line in the jvm file.. but it doesn't seem to exist any longer?
no but I was just slightly confused because I just follow the instructions from a-z.
consider your java configured. eclipse should work. had it complained about not having /etc/jvm or anything else, come back and state your problem ;)
Hey, everything works now, and thank you so much for you patience (:
and no Eclipse does not complain at all (:
